intro: Erica viscidiflora, commonly known as the sticky-flowered heath, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in fynbos vegetation. Erica viscidiflora produces fragrant, pink or white flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is a hardy plant that thrives in coastal and mountainous regions with mild, wet winters.
